intro: Acourtia parryi, commonly known as the Parry's acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the spring, and it has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Acourtia parryi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
